data.title: Notes from the frontier: Making AI work
data.description: Drawing on the McKinsey Global Institute’s research, Michael Chui explores commonly asked questions about AI and its impact on work.

data.title: How social science research can inform the design of AI systems
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Jacob Ward on the interplay between psychology, decision-making, and AI systems.

data.title: The state of automation technologies
data.description: Ben Lorica and Roger Chen highlight recent trends in data, compute, and machine learning.

data.title: Why we built a self-writing Wikipedia
data.description: Amy Heineike explains how Primer created a self-updating knowledge base that can track factual claims in unstructured text.

data.title: AI for a better world
data.description: Ashok Srivastava draws upon his cross-industry experience to paint an encouraging picture of how AI can solve big problems.

data.title: Highlights from the Artificial Intelligence Conference in London 2018
data.description: Watch highlights from expert talks covering artificial intelligence, machine learning, automation, and more.

data.title: Rethinking software engineering in the AI era
data.description: Yangqing Jia talks about what makes AI software unique and its connections to conventional computer science wisdom.

data.title: AI in production: The droids you’re looking for
data.description: Jonathan Ballon explains why Intel’s AI and computer vision edge technology will drive advances in machine learning and natural language processing.

data.title: What we learn from AI’s biases
data.description: Our bad AI could be the best tool we have for understanding how to be better people.

data.title: ML on code: Machine learning will change programming
data.description: Francesc Campoy Flores explores ways machine learning can help developers be more efficient.

data.title: Why it’s hard to design fair machine learning models
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Sharad Goel and Sam Corbett-Davies on the limitations of popular mathematical formalizations of fairness.

data.title: Practical ML today and tomorrow
data.description: Hilary Mason explores the current state of AI and ML and what’s coming next in applied ML.

data.title: Black box: How AI will amplify the best and worst of humanity
data.description: Jacob Ward reveals the relationship between the unconscious habits of our minds and the way that AI is poised to amplify them, alter them, maybe even reprogram them.

data.title: Using machine learning to improve dialog flow in conversational applications
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Alan Nichol on building a suite of open source tools for chatbot developers.

data.title: Preserving privacy and security in machine learning
data.description: Ben Lorica offers an overview of recent tools for building privacy-preserving and secure machine learning products and services.

data.title: Highlights from the Strata Data Conference in New York 2018
data.description: Watch highlights from expert talks covering data science, machine learning, algorithmic accountability, and more.

data.title: The ethics of data flow
data.description: If we’re going to think about the ethics of data and how it’s used, then we have to take into account how data flows.

data.title: The breadth of AI applications: The ongoing expansion
data.description: Peter Norvig says one of the most exciting aspects of AI is the diversity of applications in fields far astray from the original breakthrough areas.

data.title: A new golden age for computer architecture
data.description: David Patterson explains why he expects an outpouring of co-designed ML-specific chips and supercomputers.

data.title: Machine learning in the cloud
data.description: Hagay Lupesko explores key trends in machine learning, the importance of designing models for scale, and the impact that machine learning innovation has had on startups and enterprises alike.

data.title: Accelerating AI on Xeon through SW optimization
data.description: Huma Abidi discusses the importance of optimization to deep learning frameworks.

data.title: AI and security: Lessons, challenges, and future directions
data.description: Dawn Song explains how AI and deep learning can enable better security and how security can enable better AI.

data.title: Highlights from the Artificial Intelligence Conference in San Francisco 2018
data.description: Watch highlights from expert talks covering artificial intelligence, machine learning, security, and more.

data.title: Beyond hype: AI in the real world
data.description: Julie Shin Choi reviews real-world customer use cases that take AI from theory to reality.

data.title: AI foundations: What shapes the AI that’s shaping our world?
data.description: Meredith Whittaker says the benefits of AI will only come if we have a clear-eyed perspective on its dark side.

data.title: OpenAI and the path toward safe AGI
data.description: Greg Brockman discusses OpenAI's recent advancements and their implications for how we should plan for creating safe artificial general intelligence (AGI).

data.title: China: AI superpower
data.description: Kai-Fu Lee outlines the factors that enabled China's rapid ascension in AI.

data.title: Fireside chat with Tim O’Reilly and Kai-Fu Lee
data.description: Tim O'Reilly and Kai-Fu Lee discuss differences in how China and the U.S. approach AI and why AI might give humanity larger purpose.

data.title: Unlocking innovation in AI
data.description: Ben Lorica and Roger Chen provide a glimpse into tools and trends poised to accelerate AI innovation.

data.title: Building accessible tools for large-scale computation and machine learning
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Eric Jonas on Pywren, scientific computation, and machine learning.
